title: Suspect Shot by FBI Outside CIA Headquarters Dies
sub_head: The FBI said the armed man in Monday’s standoff died from his injuries
body:
A man shot by at least one FBI agent after an hourslong standoff outside the Central Intelligence Agency’s headquarters has died, the FBI said Tuesday, a day after the incident.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation said Monday night that at least one agent shot and wounded the man, who had emerged from his vehicle carrying a weapon outside the CIA’s headquarters in McLean, Va.
“The subject involved in the shooting incident outside CIA Headquarters at approximately 6 p.m. on Monday, May 3, 2021, died from his injuries after being transported to the hospital,” the FBI’s Washington Field Office said Tuesday.
The FBI said it is reviewing the shooting according to its procedures, including examining the circumstances and collecting evidence from the scene. The bureau has released few other details, including what kind of weapon the man was carrying.
CIA security officers, local police and an FBI team responded to what the bureau initially called a report of a suspicious vehicle. The incident stretched on for hours outside the secure perimeter of the CIA’s headquarters by the main gate.
